results.title: The Three robbers
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Based on the story by Tomi Ungerer, this animated tale is about three fierce robbers who terrify the countryside until they meet a little girl named Tiffany. Under Tiffany’s golden charm the robbers turn their gold to good use and all ends happily in this droll tale heightened by bold colourful illustrations. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Three musketeers. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Paul Killiam, Saul J. Turell and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”
An edited version of the 1921 silent film version of the Dumas novel starring Douglas Fairbanks in the role of D’Artagnan, with added commentary. A cloak-and-dagger adventure romance with sequences of lively duels, chases and acrobatics, and the drama of court intrigue, illustrating the silent action film at its best, adaptation of a popular novel to the screen, and the work of Fairbanks.

results.title: The Three musketeers
results.creator_credit: Pandro S. Berman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and George Sidney
results.brief_description: The third talkie version of Alexander Dumas famed story of D’Artagnan - a young man seeking his fortune in 17th Century France. MGM created a splashy production with an all-star cast for this swashbuckling adventure movie, filmed in Technicolor. Gene Kelly gives the impression of having a fabulous time playing the title role of a young anti-authoritarian upstart, a talented swordsman with an eye for attractive ladies of the Court. D’Artagnan joins the three musketeers, Athos, Porthos and Aramis, in order to save their beleageared queen from disgrace. To do so they much face the Machiavellian Milady De Winter and Richelieu. The film, a curious mix of melodrama and burlesque, was one of the top earning films of 1948.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pandro S. Berman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and George Sidney

results.title: The Three musketeers
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Joe Roth, Roger Birnbaum and Stephen Herek
results.brief_description: This Disney adaptation of the classic 17th century French novel by Alexandre Dumas features Chris O’Donnell in the lead role of the swashbuckling hero D’Artagnan, a musketeer in the King’s guards in Paris. When D’Artagnan discovers that the scheming Cardinal Richelieu (Tim Curry) is plotting to oust the King from his throne, he joins up with three other musketeers - Athos (Kiefer Sutherland), Porthos (Oliver Platt), and Aramis (Charlie Sheen) - to protect King and country and thwart the unscrupulous Cardinal’s plans. Also stars Rebeccca De Mornay as Milady de Winter. Beautiful cinematography by Dean Semler and lavish costuming and set design.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Pictures, Joe Roth, Roger Birnbaum and Stephen Herek

results.title: The Three monks (K)
results.brief_description: An animated story about co-operation in which three monks squabble over the chore of fetching water to put out the fire in their temple. Considers the benefit of teamwork as opposed to thinking only of oneself.

results.title: The Three little pigs (K)
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gagne, Weston Woods Studios and Jan Mack
results.brief_description: The legendary story of the three pigs and the greedy, scheming wolf comes to glorious “huffing, puffing” life as the wolf tries his best to outsmart the pigs and at last meets his comeuppance. This favourite story features a lively narration by Ian Thompson. Based on the book by Erik Blegvad.
